intro: Weinmannia crassifolia f. cochabambensis, commonly known as the Cochabamba Weinmannia, is a shrub or small tree native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and distinctive inflorescences. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptic, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by spherical, woody fruits. This plant thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cooler, humid conditions of its native habitat.
